Dive into the world of Anthony Perkins Movies as we unravel the intricacies of the actorâ€™s extraordinary filmography. From his iconic role as Norman Bates in Alfred Hitchcockâ€™s Psycho to lesser-known gems, weâ€™ll explore Perkinsâ€™ range and impact on the industry. Join us on this captivating journey through cinema history.

As an Amazonâ„¢ Associate, we earn from qualifying purchases.

1. The Actress (1953)

The Actress (1953) is a heartwarming and charming biographical comedy-drama based on the true life experiences of stage and screen actress/playwright Ruth Gordon. Directed by none other than the legendary George Cukor, the film stars iconic actors Spencer Tracy, Jean Simmons, and Teresa Wright, and is produced by the esteemed Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM).
